@graph.name: Tempeh Tikka Pulao. Vegan Gluten-free Recipe - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: This Tempeh Tikka Pulao has crisped up tempeh cooked with spices and onions and Rice cooked with whole spices. flavorful Diwali Side. Vegan Gluten-free

itemListElement.name: Tempeh Tikka Pulao. Vegan Gluten-free Recipe

@graph.name: Tempeh Tikka Pulao
@graph.description: This tikka Pulao is simple and packs a lot of flavor. Serve it with non dairy raita or chutneys. Free of Dairy, egg, corn, gluten.
recipeIngredient: 8 oz package Tempeh cubed into 1/2 inch or smaller cubes (1 3/4 cup or 1/4 inch thin slices)
1/2 cup thinly sliced green bell pepper
2 tsp ginger paste (or an inch ginger crushed)
2 tsp garlic paste (or 3 cloves of garlic crushed)
2 Tbsp finely chopped tomato  (or crushed tomatoes)
1/2 tsp chaat masala  (or dry mango powder)
1 tsp organic canola or safflower oil
1/4  cup Pomegranate arils (or other fruit or finely chopped ripe tomatoes)

itemListElement.text: 1. In a medium skillet, add oil and heat at medium. Add onions and bell pepper and cook until translucent. 6 minutes.
itemListElement.name: 1. In a medium skillet, add oil and heat at medium. Add onions and bell pepper and cook until translucent. 6 minutes.

itemListElement.text: 2. Add the tempeh, ginger, garlic, cayenne, garam masala, fenugreek leaves and salt. Mix well and cook for 2 minutes.
itemListElement.name: 2. Add the tempeh, ginger, garlic, cayenne, garam masala, fenugreek leaves and salt. Mix well and cook for 2 minutes.

itemListElement.text: 3. Add water, cilantro, tomato, mix and cook uncovered for 18 to 20 minutes or until the water is completely absorbed.
itemListElement.name: 3. Add water, cilantro, tomato, mix and cook uncovered for 18 to 20 minutes or until the water is completely absorbed.

itemListElement.text: 4. Add non dairy milk, chickpea flour , lemon juice, chaat masala, sugar. Mix well and cook until most of the liquid is gone. 3 minutes. Keep aside.
itemListElement.name: 4. Add non dairy milk, chickpea flour , lemon juice, chaat masala, sugar. Mix well and cook until most of the liquid is gone. 3 minutes. Keep aside.

itemListElement.text: 1. Wash and soak the rice in warm water for 15 minutes. The soaking helps make fluffy rice with visible individual grains.
itemListElement.name: 1. Wash and soak the rice in warm water for 15 minutes. The soaking helps make fluffy rice with visible individual grains.

itemListElement.text: 2. Heat oil in a skillet at medium heat. When the oil is hot, add cumin seeds, bay leaves, cloves, cinnamon and cardamom. Cook for a minute or until fragrant.
itemListElement.name: 2. Heat oil in a skillet at medium heat. When the oil is hot, add cumin seeds, bay leaves, cloves, cinnamon and cardamom. Cook for a minute or until fragrant.

itemListElement.text: 3. Drain the rice and add to the pan. Mix well.  Add salt, saffron, raisins, and water, mix and bring to a boil.
itemListElement.name: 3. Drain the rice and add to the pan. Mix well.  Add salt, saffron, raisins, and water, mix and bring to a boil.

itemListElement.text: 4. Reduce heat to low and let the rice cook for 10 to 12 minutes or until all the liquid has been absorbed. Take off heat. Use a fork fluff the rice. Add half of Tempeh mixture and mix in. Cover and let the rice sit for 5 minutes.
itemListElement.name: 4. Reduce heat to low and let the rice cook for 10 to 12 minutes or until all the liquid has been absorbed. Take off heat. Use a fork fluff the rice. Add half of Tempeh mixture and mix in. Cover and let the rice sit for 5 minutes.

itemListElement.text: 5. To serve, add rice to a bowl, add some of the Tempeh tikka mixture, lemon juice, pomegranate or other fruit, cilantro and mint. Serve with non dairy yogurt or as a side with any light curry. This is a dryer rice side with a lot of flavor. Dress with non dairy yogurt/raita, cashew cream or mint cilantro chutney if serving by itself. Remove and discard the whole spices just before serving.
itemListElement.name: 5. To serve, add rice to a bowl, add some of the Tempeh tikka mixture, lemon juice, pomegranate or other fruit, cilantro and mint. Serve with non dairy yogurt or as a side with any light curry. This is a dryer rice side with a lot of flavor. Dress with non dairy yogurt/raita, cashew cream or mint cilantro chutney if serving by itself. Remove and discard the whole spices just before serving.
